version_1_2_1.title: Improvements and Fixes
version_1_2_1.description: This version introduces app modularity in the frontend and resolves important race conditions related to tokens and themes.

changes.feature_1: Modularity: in the frontend, apps have been divided into modules through a specific architecture to facilitate the addition and detachment of the module.
changes.feature_2: Refresh token BFF Endpoint: the access_token refresh endpoint has been added to the BFF server as this API call must be made by the Client (which communicates obligatorily with the BFF server) and no longer by middleware.ts, respecting the rules of the BFF Pattern architecture.
changes.feature_3: Tooltips: Tooltips have been added to briefly explain the function of a given button on mouse hover.
changes.bugfix_1: Token race condition: the race condition for which the access_token was not refreshed correctly was fixed, so every 5 minutes, upon its refresh, users were redirected to `/dashboard`.
changes.bugfix_2: Save Theme race condition: the theme race condition was fixed via a `debouncer` for which the theme shown in the UI was not always synchronized with its respective value in the database.
changes.bugfix_3: Issue #6 Fixed: issue #6 was fixed as a 400 error could be displayed in the terminal during access_token refresh. This error was caused by the token race condition.
changes.bugfix_4: Scroll on Grid contents: scroll was fixed for page content that exceeded the available space during Grid Mode.
changes.bugfix_5: Header Version Page: the z-index of the page header was fixed to display the releases of the various versions, as it overlapped the sidebar header when scrolling.
changes.bugfix_6: nav-user.tsx: Fixed user typing in the file, using the `User` type defined in `/types/user.ts`.

version_1_2_0.title: Grid System
version_1_2_0.description: Full implementation of the grid system for multi-screen visualization and advanced layout management.

changes.feature_1: GridStore implementation with Zustand for complete grid state management
changes.feature_2: GridSection component for rendering and managing individual sections
changes.feature_4: Full support for assigning tabs to grid sections
changes.feature_5: Virtual Pages system for dynamic content in sections
changes.feature_6: Drag & Drop for dragging tabs into sections
changes.feature_7: GridModeToggle component for grid mode control
changes.feature_8: PageSelector for assigning specific pages to sections
changes.feature_9: TabContentRenderer specialized for tab content in grid
changes.feature_10: Smart Navigation integration with active grid mode
changes.details_1: The grid system represents a qualitative leap in user experience, allowing simultaneous viewing of multiple contents with professional layout management.
changes.improvement_1: Responsive layout that automatically adapts to screen dimensions
changes.improvement_2: Optimized algorithms for section positioning and resizing
changes.improvement_3: Automatic persistence of grid state between user sessions
changes.improvement_4: Optimized performance for rendering complex layouts
changes.security_1: Robust validation of grid states to prevent layout corruption
changes.security_2: Secure memory management for complex layouts

version_1_1_0.title: Tab Navigation
version_1_1_0.description: Added sidebar element navigation via tabs.

changes.feature_1: Components added to allow navigation with Tabs.
changes.feature_2: CSS added to hide the scrollbar without disabling scrolling.
changes.feature_3: Added alert dialog that is shown when disabling tab mode without closing them.
changes.details_1: The tab navigation system significantly improves user experience by allowing efficient multitasking.
changes.improvement_2: Improved accessibility with keyboard navigation support
changes.bugfix_1: Resolved memory leak issues in tab management
changes.bugfix_2: Fixed state synchronization issue between components

version_1_0_0.title: Initial web application release
version_1_0_0.description: First public version: containerized architecture, secure authentication, REST API, Next.js frontend with advanced state management and modern UI.

changes.feature_1: Fully containerized setup with Docker and Docker Compose for backend and frontend.
changes.feature_2: Next.js server as Backend for Frontend (BFF) with SSR rendering, API route protection and JWT validation.
changes.feature_3: Secure communication between frontend and backend containers via Docker network.
changes.feature_4: Backend developed with Django and Django REST Framework.
changes.feature_5: JWT authentication via dj-rest-auth and djangorestframework-simplejwt.
changes.feature_6: Asymmetric JWT validation strategy: private key signing, public endpoint for public key.
changes.feature_7: Secure storage of JWT tokens in cookies (refresh_token httpOnly, access_token standard).
changes.feature_8: API endpoints for registration, login, logout, password reset and user data retrieval.
changes.feature_9: Next.js frontend (App Router), React and TypeScript.
changes.feature_11: Data fetching and caching with TanStack Query (React Query).
changes.feature_12: Axios API client to the BFF.
changes.feature_13: UI with Radix UI, Shadcn UI and Tailwind CSS.
changes.feature_15: Role-based protected routing via Next.js directory and middleware.
changes.feature_16: Next.js middleware for private route protection.
changes.feature_17: Server-side JWT validation in BFF via jose.
changes.improvement_1: ESLint configured to maintain high frontend code standards.
changes.improvement_2: Example files for environment variables (example.env, example.env.local) for backend and frontend.
changes.bugfix_1: No significant bug fixes in this initial release.
